title: What to do if you can’t access any website when you connect to the VPN
author: Jamie
content:
If you can’t access any website after connecting to the VPN, the methodology described in this article can help you to solve this problem.

Lets Vpn is a network software, it will need to request permissions for Network Access, notice that on Windows operating systems when the software request network access, a popup will appear, as following picture shows.

When you see this popup please check both options and click the "allow access" so our software works properly.

And if you click “cancel”, these are what happens.

  • Many websites you can’t reach
  • Time out error in browser
  • The website is available but now won’t open.

When it happens please don’t worry, we can whitelist our program in Windows Firewall to solve this problem.

How to check Windows Firewall Settings and allow our software to access network?

In Windows 10, 8, 7 how to check windows firewall settings is different, please see the following flowchart for a step-by-step description of how to do it with a common methodology:

Please follow the steps below to find windows firewall and allow LetsVPN to access network:

  1. Press the “Win+R” and then input “control” and “enter”
  2. At the top left: by category
  3. Click “System and Security”
  4. You can see “Windows Firewall”
  5. Click “Allow a program through Windows Firewall”
  6. Click “Change settings”
  7. Check the options settings named “Lets” (include private and public networks)

When all of these steps are completed successfully you will see the picture below.

Then please connect VPN again, you can try to visit websites you like, see if you can access it normally?

How to do under other circumstance

If you follow the above steps but the issue hasn’t been solved yet, let's take a look at some special cases.

When you click the Windows firewall settings but it doesn’t respond

Follow the earlier steps you need to click “Allow a program through Windows firewall”, but maybe you click there but it does not respond, this can happen for reasons, the windows 7 firewall on your computer is in abnormal state, please read the below articles to solve the problem.

  • How can vpn work well if the Windows 7 firewall is in abnormal state

Special network card issue

Some NIC or hardware and its corresponding software has the network management function, but it will lead to some problems, please see the below articles:

  • What to do if you have a Killer network card and website is unavailable
    This kind of network card could be seen in ALIENWARE, MSI, Dell, Acer, Razer or Lenovo computer.

If you still can’t visit websites normally according to this method, please send an email to letsvpn@rbox.me and our customer service staff will help you to solve the problem.

Did this answer your question?
